author: Alexis Gabriel Ainouz
notes: Alex's brioche. This recipe was transcribed from the Youtube video by me, Aryn Harmon. Of the first four times I've made brioche, the first was excellent, and the next two were uncooked in the center. For the fourth, I lowered the temperature to 350F and extended the cooking time to about 35 minutes.
method: Beat together the flour, eggs, milk, and yeast.
Add the butter, sugar, salt; mix and knead until the dough forms a smooth, elastic ball (best done with a stand mixer, but it can be done by hand).
Push down the dough. Divide and roll into three long logs, each with a diameter between one and one and a half inches.
Braid the three logs together, then place them in a lightly buttered loaf tin.
Cover for a second proof, about 20 minutes, or until it just rises out of the loaf tin.
Brush on the egg wash, then bake for about 25 minutes at 390F. (See notes for updates to cooking time)
Let the loaf cool for a couple minutes.
